page.title: 08THE METHODIST CHURCH
page.content: Anslow Methodist Church is one-roomed, is very plain and has no stained glass windows or altar, there is just a table with a cross on it.The other chapels in this area are,St.Thomas's,Queensbridge, Barton and Woodmill.Horninglow has been demolished through lack of congregation The church is 80 years old,which is the same age as most of the chapels. St.Thomas's is the biggest chapel in the area,it is on Belvedere Road.This area includes Burton North-West,Burton South-West, Anslow,Oxhall and Barton under Need- wood.St.Thomas's has no cemetary,but there are about 6 funerals,12 weddings and 1 or 2 baptisms on average per year There is a Sunday school,Wives group, 2 youth clubs and a Mother and baby club. It costs about 7,000 pounds to maintain the church each year.
